Description: Oval plaque of wood: possibly the terminal piece for the butt-end of an axe-haft. It contains no holes for inlay. It has a deep split at one end and small cracks and abrasions in several places.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 116 (grave no. 3122), 127, 128, pls. lxx, lxxiv, 1, 0.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (172)
